App description:
Experience the pulse-pounding excitement of boxing with the cinematic thrill of a blockbuster movie as you become Adonis Creed, fighting to establish your legacy in the ring and beyond. 

 Live Your Legacy: Challenge both your body and mind as you experience the ascent of Adonis Creed from undiscovered underdog to world-class fighter, all within an immersive universe inspired by the Creed films.
 Multiple Game Modes: Choose your path to glory in multiple game modes: story-driven Career, customizable Freeplay, or minigame-based Training.
 Online PvP: The fight just a lot more personal. Set up custom fights with friends or find your contenders in crossplay Quick Match.
 Feel the Impact: Phantom Melee Technology mimics the real-life effects of throwing and taking punches in the ring, such as the out-of-body sensation of getting knocked out or the strain of fatigue during a long, frantic bout.

antoine.bartJun 30, 2019 at 4:44 AM
Good fun but frustrating

Hi Everyone - Hi to the devs,

I only rate this game 3 stars as there are still some technical issues triggering a lot of frustration in game for me - Mind, I'm going to bash open doors here as most of the complains I have have already been mentioned by other players.
As a former amateur boxer, I jumped straight into the gym for a bit of training to see whether I could get a bit of sweat going on and enjoy the game mechanics.

I find the tracking issues to be the most frustrating:
- when you get some padwork (with Balboa THAT is awesome), it's not clear why some punches do register and some don't. (speed? hands positioning?) Following advice I found online, I tried to keep my hands well inside the tracking area of the device, but still, I found my gloves weren't where I wanted them to be way too often. (or is it my muscle memory that makes me position my hands too close to my head, hence losing track, without even realising it?)
- when I move freely in the gym with the intention of picking and choosing a workout, I tend to position myself in relation to my real life reach. Starting a minigame just messes up your reach, distance and placement towards the target. I find that the default starting position is way too close forcing me to step back - and therefore messing your Guardian setup.
It might be my boxing style that doesn't work great with the game, but I find it difficult to keep the distance, as the game keeps pushing the target right in front of your face when you're just trying to get your reach right.
I'd much prefer it if the game would allow to trust the player to position themselves properly and not force their positioning system onto you.

So overall, it's a good game, hats off to the devs! But players that know a minimum about boxing, sparred and trained in real life, will find the limitations frustrating.

Let's hope the devs come up with a nice update and Oculus fixes that tracking issue soon!

Best, A.
